quote-text: When my son came to me at age 15 and said, “Mom, I’m gay,” I cried … not because he was gay, but because I know the world can be cruel, and one day I would have to let him go to face it without me. To me, you are just like him … precious, irreplaceable and bravely facing an uncertain world. Just like my own child, during this holiday season and always, you have a welcomed place in my home and in my heart.
quote-source: Mom Logan, Happy Holidays: Mom Logan, Your Holiday Mom, December 1, 2012.
